alert.note: Alert for Potter (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 1:50PM CDT until May 30 at 10:20AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Canadian River at Amarillo 19N affecting Potter County. .Recent rainfall has lead to upstream flooding in the Ady area. Flood waters have risen quite a bit in the past 6 hours in Ady. This gives reason that the river should rise to at least minor flood stage in the next 3 to 9 hours at the Amarillo 19 north gauge. For the Canadian River...including Amarillo 19N...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Canadian River at Amarillo 19N. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Dirt road that runs east alongside the river channel becomes flooded. This road leads to Rosita Creek Flats Recreation Area, where primitive camping occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CDT Monday the stage was 4.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 7.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.7 feet on 08/10/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
